title: Reform (pursuant to the Ministers and Secretaries Acts 1924 to 2020) hereby
heading: 1. Where a member incurs expenses connected with improvements to their
text_raw:
1. Where a member incurs expenses connected with improvements to their 
personal security to meet a credible and serious threat to their personal physical 
security arising from their role as an elected member of a local authority, the 
member’s local authority shall pay on a once-off basis to the member a sum not 
exceeding €2,500, or 50% of their total costs, whichever is the lesser, in final 
settlement of a claim under the allowance in respect of security measures, 
following receipt of claim for these expenses. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 15th September, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2. A member may make a claim for payment of a sum under this Regulation 
to the local authority of which he or she is a member in such form and containing 
such particulars as set out in directions the Minister may give under Regulation

title: Reform (pursuant to the Ministers and Secretaries Acts 1924 to 2020) hereby
heading: 3. (1) A local authority shall not make a payment in respect of a security
text_raw:
3. (1) A local authority shall not make a payment in respect of a security 
allowance to a member except in accordance with the Act of 2001 and with these 
Regulations. 

(2) A local authority shall not make a payment in respect of a security 
allowance unless it is satisfied that such a payment and the amount of the 
proposed payment can properly be made in accordance with the Act of 2001 and 
with these Regulations.

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the payment of a security allowance to elected 
members of local authorities to defray expenses accrued where an elected 
member has made improvements to their personal physical security to meet a 
credible and serious threat to their person arising from their role as an elected 
member of a local authority and the keeping of records in relation to payments 
of same in accordance with Section 142 of the Local Government Act 2001.
